member.name: F:DoubleAgent.Server.BalloonStyleFlags.AutoHide
member.summary: The word balloon is hidden automatically after a short delay.

remarks.para: When the style is set, the word balloon automatically hides when spoken output completes. When it's not set, the word balloon remains displayed until the next or call, the character is hidden, or the user clicks or drags the character.

member.name: F:DoubleAgent.Server.BalloonStyleFlags.AutoPace
member.summary: The text in the word balloon is shown one word at a time.

remarks.para: When the style is set, the word balloon paces its text output based on the current output rate, for example one word at a time. When output exceeds the size of the word balloon, the text is automatically scrolled. When it's not set, all text included in a or request is displayed at once.

member.name: F:DoubleAgent.Server.BalloonStyleFlags.Enabled
member.summary: The word balloon is enabled.

remarks.para: When the style is set, the word balloon appears when the or method is used, unless the user overrides this setting in the Advanced Character Options window. When it's not set, the word balloon does not appear.

member.name: F:DoubleAgent.Server.BalloonStyleFlags.NoAppend
member.summary: Prevents the word balloon from appending text when it's already visible (for a word balloon that's not SizeToText).

remarks.para: When the style is set, the word balloon will not append new text to existing text. When it's not set, new text is appended if the word balloon is visible. This style only applies when the style is not set.

member.name: F:DoubleAgent.Server.BalloonStyleFlags.ShowPartialLines
member.summary: Partial lines are shown when the word balloon text scrolls (for a word balloon that's not SizeToText).

remarks.para: When the style is set, the word balloon will show partial lines at the bottom as it scrolls its text. When it's not set, only full lines are shown. This style only applies when the style is not set.

member.name: F:DoubleAgent.Server.BalloonStyleFlags.SizeToText
member.summary: The word balloon is automatically resized to fit the speech or thought text.

remarks.para: When the style is set, the word balloon automatically adjusts the height of the word balloon to the current size of the text for the or request. When it's not set, the word balloon's height is based on the property. If this style is set and you attempt to set the property, Double Agent raises an error.

summary.para: Specifies settings that affect a word balloon's appearance and behaviour.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.Load(System.Object,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Loads a from it's definition file, if it's not already loaded.
member.param:
One of the following:
Filespec … The location of a local character definition file (.ACS format)
URL … The HTTP address of the character's definition file (.ACF format)
A value that the server uses to uniquely identify the loaded Object.
An optional unique numeric value your application can use to track the method's status.

remarks.para: You can load characters from the default location(s) by specifying only a file name. For example, specifying the following would search for Genie.acs using the "search path".

codeSample.para: You can also specify an absolute location,
or specify your own subdirectory by using a relative path.

remarks.para: You can load the default character by passing an empty VARIANT for the Provider parameter. This will load the default character from the "default file path".

You cannot load the same character (a character having the same ) more than once from a single instance of the Object. Similarly, you cannot load the default character and other characters at the same time from a single instance of the Object because the default character could be the same as the other character. If you attempt to do this, Double Agent raises an error. However, you can create another instance of the Object and load the same character, because each Object instance is treated as an individual server client.
Loading a character does not automatically display the character. Use the method first to make the character visible.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.CharacterStyle
member.summary: Specifies the initial style to use when a is loaded.
member.returns:
A numeric bit-field value that specifies the to apply when a is loaded:
0x00000001 = SoundEffects … The animation sound effects are played.
0x00000002 = IdleEnabled … The character enters idle mode and shows it's idling animations when it's not doing anything else.
0x00000004 = AutoPopupMenu … A right-click on the character or it's notification icon automatically shows a pop-up menu.
0x00000008 = IconShown … The character has a notification icon in the taskbar notification area.
0x00000020 = SmoothEdges … Image smoothing (antialiasing) is applied to the edges of the character's animations.
0x00000030 = Smoothed … Image smoothing (antialiasing) is applied to the character's animations.
0x00000100 = SuspendPause … All requests are paused when the client is not in the foreground.
0x00000200 = SuspendStop … All requests are stopped when the client is not in the foreground.
0x00000400 = SuspendHide … All floating windows are hidden when the client is not in the foreground.

remarks.para: Setting this property allows you to establish a default . for you application. It's initial value is , , , .

The and flags can only be changed here. Once a is loaded, these bits cannot be changed in it's property. Also, these two settings are only used the first time the character is loaded. If another client has already loaded the character, it's smoothing settings will not change. If your client application is the first client to load the character, then your smoothing settings will apply to all clients.
remarks.note: For compatibility with Microsoft® Agent, the flag is set by default. To load a without showing it's notification icon, set the flag off.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.ActivateInputState
member.summary: Signalled when a client's input-active state changes.
member.param: The unique identifier of the character who's input-active state has changed.
True if the character has become input-active or False it is has become non-input-active.
member.remarks:
The input-active client receives mouse and speech input events for the character. Double Agent sends this event only to the client that becomes input-active and the client that becomes non-input-active.
This event can occur when the user uses your Collection, for example, by choosing a Collection entry in the Voice Commands window or in the pop-up menu window for a character. It can also occur when the user selects a character (by clicking or speaking its name), when a character becomes visible, or when the character of another client application becomes hidden. You can also call the method with set to 2 () to explicitly make the character topmost, which results in your client application becoming input-active and triggers this event. However, this event does not occur if you use the method only to specify whether or not your client is the active client of the character.

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.ActiveClientChange
member.summary: Signalled when the active client of the character changes.
member.param: The unique identifier of the character that has become active or inactive.

A member of the Enumeration indicating the state of the character and your client application:
0 = Inactive … Your client application is not the character's active client.
1 = Active … Your client application is the character's active client.
2 = InputActive … The character is the input-active character and will receive user input.

remarks.para: When multiple clients ( instances) share the same character, the active client of the character receives mouse input (for example, click or drag events). Similarly, when multiple characters are displayed, the active client of the topmost character (also known as the input-active client) receives events.

A client application may receive this event when the user selects one of the client's entries in the character's pop-up menu or by voice command, when the client application changes its active status, or when another client terminates.
Double Agent sends this event only to the clients that are directly affected; that either become the active client or stop being the active client.

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.Click
member.summary: Signalled when the user clicks a character, or the character's notification icon.
member.param: The unique identifier of the character that was clicked.

A numeric value that identifies which mouse button caused the event, and which modifier keys were down at the time. The parameter is a bit field with bits as follows:
bit 0 (0x0001) … The left button
bit 1 (0x0002) … The right button
bit 2 (0x0004) … the Shift key is down
bit 3 (0x0004) … the Ctrl key is down
bit 4 (0x0010) … The middle button
bit 5 (0x0020) … the Alt key is down
bit 13 (0x1000) … the click occurred on the notification icon Only one of the button bits is set, indicating the mouse button that caused the event. Some, all, or none of the modifier bits can be set, indicating that some, all, or none of the modifier keys are down.
The current horizontal location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the left side of the screen.
The current vertical location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the top of the screen.

remarks.para: This event is sent only to the input-active client of a character. When the user clicks a character or its notification icon with no input-active client, Double Agent sends the event to its active client. If the character is visible ( is True), the user's action also sets the character's current input-active client as the last input-active client, sending the event to that client, and then sending the Click event. If the character is hidden ( is False), and the user clicks the character's notification icon using button 1, the character is also automatically shown.

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.Command
member.summary: Signalled when the user chooses a (client's) command.
member.param: The unique identifier of the character that was clicked.
A Object that identifies the chosen command.

remarks.para: Double Agent sends this event when your application is input-active and the user chooses a command from the character's pop-up menu, or by spoken input.

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.DblClick
member.summary: Signalled when the user double-clicks a character.
member.param: The unique identifier of the character that was double-clicked.

A numeric value that identifies which mouse button caused the event, and which modifier keys were down at the time. The parameter is a bit field with bits as follows:
bit 0 (0x0001) … The left button
bit 1 (0x0002) … The right button
bit 2 (0x0004) … the Shift key is down
bit 3 (0x0004) … the Ctrl key is down
bit 4 (0x0010) … The middle button
bit 5 (0x0020) … the Alt key is down
bit 13 (0x1000) … the click occurred on the notification icon Only one of the button bits is set, indicating the mouse button that caused the event. Some, all, or none of the modifier bits can be set, indicating that some, all, or none of the modifier keys are down.
The current horizontal location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the left side of the screen.
The current vertical location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the top of the screen.

remarks.para: This event is sent only to the input-active client of a character. When the user double-clicks a character or its notification icon with no input-active client, Double Agent sends the event to its active client. If the character is visible ( is True), the user's action also sets the character's current input-active client as the last input-active client, sending the event to that client, and then sending the DblClick event. If the character is hidden ( is False), and the user double-clicks the character's notification icon using button 1, the character is also automatically shown.

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.DefaultCharacterChange
member.summary: Signalled when the user changes the default character.
member.param: The unique identifier of the new default character.

remarks.para: This event indicates that the user has changed the character assigned as the user's default character. Double Agent sends this only to clients that have loaded the default character.
When the new character appears, it assumes the same size as any already loaded instance of the character, or the size of the previous default character (in that order).

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.DragComplete
member.summary: Signalled when the user stops dragging a character.
member.param: The unique identifier of the character that was dragged.

A numeric value that identifies which mouse button caused the event, and which modifier keys were down at the time. The parameter is a bit field with bits as follows:
bit 0 (0x0001) … The left button
bit 1 (0x0002) … The right button
bit 2 (0x0004) … the Shift key is down
bit 3 (0x0004) … the Ctrl key is down
bit 4 (0x0010) … The middle button
bit 5 (0x0020) … the Alt key is down
bit 13 (0x1000) … the click occurred on the notification icon Only one of the button bits is set, indicating the mouse button that caused the event. Some, all, or none of the modifier bits can be set, indicating that some, all, or none of the modifier keys are down.
The current horizontal location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the left side of the screen.
The current vertical location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the top of the screen.

remarks.para: This event is sent only to the input-active client of a character. When the user drags a character with no input-active client, Double Agent sets its current input-active client as the last input-active client, sending the event to that client, and then sending the and DragComplete events.

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.DragStart
member.summary: Signalled when the user starts dragging a character.
member.param: The unique identifier of the character that's being dragged.

A numeric value that identifies which mouse button caused the event, and which modifier keys were down at the time. The parameter is a bit field with bits as follows:
bit 0 (0x0001) … The left button
bit 1 (0x0002) … The right button
bit 2 (0x0004) … the Shift key is down
bit 3 (0x0004) … the Ctrl key is down
bit 4 (0x0010) … The middle button
bit 5 (0x0020) … the Alt key is down
bit 13 (0x1000) … the click occurred on the notification icon Only one of the button bits is set, indicating the mouse button that caused the event. Some, all, or none of the modifier bits can be set, indicating that some, all, or none of the modifier keys are down.
The current horizontal location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the left side of the screen.
The current vertical location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the top of the screen.

remarks.para: This event is sent only to the input-active client of a character. When the user drags a character with no input-active client, Double Agent sets its current input-active client as the last input-active client, sending the event to that client, and then sending the DragStart event.

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.Idle
member.summary: Signalled when a character's Idling state changes.
member.param: The unique identifier of the Idling character.
True if the character has started idling, or False if it has stopped idling.

remarks.para: Double Agent sends this event to all clients of the character.

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.ListeningState
member.summary: Signalled when Listening mode (speech recognition) begins or ends.
member.param: The unique identifier of the Listening character.
True if the character has started listening, or False if it has stopped listening.

remarks.para: This event is sent to all clients when Listening mode begins or ends because the user pressed or released the Listening key, or when the input-active client called the method, or when the Listening mode time-out ends, or when the user has finished speaking. You can use this event to avoid having your character speak while Listening mode is active.

If you turn on Listening mode using the method and then the user presses the Listening key, the Listening mode resets and continues until the Listening key time-out completes, the Listening key is released, or the user finishes speaking, whichever is later. In this situation, when Listening mode is already on, you will not get an additional ListeningState event with =True when the user presses the Listening key, and you will not receive a ListeningState event with =False until the Listening key's mode completes.

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.Move
member.summary: Signalled when a character has moved.
member.param: The unique identifier of the character that was moved.
The character's new horizontal location, in pixels, relative to the left side of the screen.
The character's new vertical location, in pixels, relative to the top of the screen.

The reason the character moved:
1 = UserMoved … The user dragged the character.
2 = ProgramMoved … Your client application moved the character.
3 = OtherProgramMoved … Another client application moved the character.

remarks.para: This event is signalled when the user or an application changes the character's position. Coordinates are relevant to the upper left corner of the screen. This event is sent only to the clients of the character (applications that have loaded the character).

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.RequestComplete
member.summary: Signalled when Double Agent completes a queued request.
member.param: The numeric value that uniquely identifies the request.

remarks.para: Because requests are processed asynchronously, you can use this event to determine when Double Agent finishes processing a request (such as a , , or method) to synchronize this event with other requests generated by your application. Double Agent sends the event only to the client that created the request.

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.RequestStart
member.summary: Signalled when Double Agent begins a queued request.
member.param: The numeric value that uniquely identifies the request.

remarks.para: Because requests are processed asynchronously, you can use this event to determine when Double Agent finishes processing a request (such as a , , or method) to synchronize this event with other requests generated by your application. Double Agent sends the event only to the client that created the request.

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.Size
member.summary: Signalled when a character's size changes.
member.param: The unique identifier of the character that was resized.
The character's new width, in pixels.
The character's new height, in pixels.

remarks.para: This event is signalled when an application changes the size of a character. This event is sent only to the clients of the character (applications that have loaded the character).

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.VisibleState
member.summary: Signalled when a character is shown or hidden.
member.param: The unique identifier of the character that was shown or hidden.
True if the character was shown, or False if it was hidden.

A value that indicates what caused the character to be shown or hidden.
1 = UserHid … The user hid the character using the command on the character's notification icon or using speech input.
2 = UserShowed … The user showed the character using the command on the character's notification icon or using speech input.
3 = ProgramHid … Your application hid the character.
4 = ProgramShowed … Your application showed the character.
5 = OtherProgramHid … Another client application hid the character.
6 = OtherProgramShowed … Another client application showed the character.

remarks.para: Double Agent sends this event to all clients of the character. To query the current state of the character, use the property.

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.SpeechStart
member.summary: Signalled when the character starts speaking for the method.
member.param: The unique identifier of the speaking character.
The that's being spoken.

remarks.note: The parameter may not contain the same reference pointer as the parameter passed to the method, but the underlying data is the same.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.SpeechEnd
member.summary: Signalled when the character stops speaking for the method.
member.param: The unique identifier of the speaking character.
The that's being spoken.
A boolean value that indicates if the speech was stopped before completion.

remarks.note: The parameter may not contain the same reference pointer as the parameter passed to the method, but the underlying data is the same.

summary.para: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.Server.Server.SpeechWord
member.summary: Signalled when the character reaches a new word for the method.
member.param: The unique identifier of the speaking character.
The that's being spoken.
A numeric value that identifies the word that is currently being spoken.

remarks.para: Because events are signalled asynchronously, the synchronization between the speech output and the receipt of this event cannot be exact. However, will generally identify the next word to be spoken.
remarks.note: The parameter may not contain the same reference pointer as the parameter passed to the method, but the underlying data is the same.

summary.para: See the event.
The Server Object establishes a connection with the Double Agent server. It allows applications to load characters, receive events, and check the current state of the server.

remarks.para: Creating an instance of the Server Object will start the Double Agent server if it's not already running. When the last Server Object is released, the Double Agent server will automatically shut down.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Balloon.BackColor
member.summary: Specifies the background color of a character's word balloon.
member.returns: A numeric value that specifies the background color.

remarks.para: The valid range for a normal RGB color is 0 to 16,777,215 (0xFFFFFF). The high byte of a number in this range equals 0; the lower 3 bytes, from least to most significant byte, determine the amount of red, green, and blue, respectively. The red, green, and blue components are each represented by a number between 0 and 255 (0xFF).
remarks.note: This property applies only to your client application's use of the character; the setting does not affect other clients of the character or other characters of your client application.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Balloon.BorderColor
member.summary: Specifies the border color of a character's word balloon.
member.returns: A numeric value that specifies the outline color.

remarks.para: The valid range for a normal RGB color is 0 to 16,777,215 (0xFFFFFF). The high byte of a number in this range equals 0; the lower 3 bytes, from least to most significant byte, determine the amount of red, green, and blue, respectively. The red, green, and blue components are each represented by a number between 0 and 255 (0xFF).
remarks.note: This property applies only to your client application's use of the character; the setting does not affect other clients of the character or other characters of your client application.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Balloon.CharsPerLine
member.summary: Specifies the characters per line used for a character's word balloon.
member.returns: A numeric value that specifies the average number of characters per line.

remarks.para: The CharsPerLine property is the average number of characters (letters) displayed in the word balloon.
remarks.note: This property applies only to your client application's use of the character; the setting does not affect other clients of the character or other characters of your client application.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Balloon.Enabled
member.summary: Indicates if the word balloon is enabled for a character.
member.returns: A boolean value that indicates if the style is set.

remarks.para: When the style is set, the word balloon appears when the or method is used, unless the user overrides this setting in the Advanced Character Options window. When it's not set, the word balloon does not appear.

The default enabled style is set as part of a character's definition when the character is compiled in the Microsoft® Agent Character Editor. If a character is defined to not support the word balloon, this property will always be False for the character.
The user can override the enabled style for all characters in the Advanced Character Options window.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Balloon.FontBold
member.summary: Specifies the font style of a character's the word balloon.
member.returns: A boolean value that indicates if the font is bold.

remarks.para: The default values for the font of a character's word balloon are set in the Microsoft® Agent Character Editor. In addition, the user can override font settings for all characters in the Advanced Character Options window.
remarks.note: This property applies only to your client application's use of the character; the setting does not affect other clients of the character or other characters of your client application.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Balloon.FontCharSet
member.summary: Specifies the character set for the font used in a character's word balloon.
member.returns: A numeric value that specifies one of the character sets supported by Windows.

remarks.para: The default values for the font of a character's word balloon are set in the Microsoft® Agent Character Editor. In addition, the user can override font settings for all characters in the Advanced Character Options window.
remarks.note: If you're using a character that you didn't compile, check the and FontCharSet properties for the character to determine whether they are appropriate for your locale. You may need to set these values before using the method to ensure appropriate text display within the word balloon.
This property applies only to your client application's use of the character; the setting does not affect other clients of the character or other characters of your client application.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Balloon.Style
member.summary: Specifies the character's word balloon output style.
member.value:
An numeric value that represents the balloon's output style. The style value is a bit field that contains values from the Enumeration:
Members
0x00000001 = Enabled … The word balloon is enabled.
0x00000002 = SizeToText … The word balloon is automatically resized to fit the speech or thought text.
0x00000004 = AutoHide … The word balloon is hidden automatically after a short delay.
0x00000008 = AutoPace … The text in the word balloon is shown one word at a time.
0x00000010 = NoAppend … Prevents the word balloon from appending text when it's already visible (for a word balloon that's not SizeToText).
0x00000020 = ShowPartialLines … Partial lines are shown when the word balloon text scrolls (for a word balloon that's not SizeToText).

remarks.para: The defaults for the Style property are set when the character is compiled with the Microsoft® Agent Character Editor.
remarks.note: The Style property can be set even if the user has disabled word balloons in the Advanced Character Options window.
This property applies only to your client application's use of the character; the setting does not affect other clients of the character or other characters of your client application.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Balloon.TextColor
member.summary: Returns the text color displayed in a character's word balloon.
member.returns: A numeric value that specifies the text color.

remarks.para: The valid range for a normal RGB color is 0 to 16,777,215 (0xFFFFFF). The high byte of a number in this range equals 0; the lower 3 bytes, from least to most significant byte, determine the amount of red, green, and blue, respectively. The red, green, and blue components are each represented by a number between 0 and 255 (0xFF).

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Balloon.Visible
member.summary: Specifies the visibility of a character's word balloon.
member.returns: A boolean value that indicates if the word balloon is visible.

remarks.para: If you follow a or call with a statement that changes this property, it may not affect the balloon's Visible state because the or call gets queued, but the call to set this property does not. Therefore, only set this value when no or calls are in the character's queue.
If you attempt to set this property while the character is speaking, moving, or being dragged, the property setting does not take effect until the preceding operation is completed.

Calling the and methods automatically makes the balloon visible, setting the Visible property to True. If the balloon's is set, the balloon is automatically hidden after the text output is complete. Clicking or dragging a character that is not currently speaking also automatically hides the balloon, even if its is not set.

summary.para: Double Agent supports textual captioning of the method using a cartoon word balloon. The method lets you display text without audio output in a thought word balloon.
The Balloon Object allows you to customize the appearance and behaviour of a character's word balloon.

remarks.para: A character's initial word balloon defaults are defined and compiled in the Microsoft® Agent Character Editor. Once running, the Balloon Object's Enabled and Font properties may be overridden by the user. If a user changes the balloon's properties, they affect all characters. Both the and balloons use the same property settings for size. You can access the properties for a character's word balloon through the Balloon Object, which is a child of the Object.
This object can be accessed using the Object's property.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Activate(System.Int16)
member.summary: Sets the active client or character.
member.param:
An optional numeric value from the Enumeration:
0 = Inactive … Your client application is not the character's active client.
1 = Active … Your client application is the character's active client.
2 = InputActive … The character is the input-active character and will receive user input.

remarks.para: Avoid calling this method directly after a method. automatically sets the input-active client. When the character is shown, the Activate call may fail if it gets processed before the method completes.
remarks.note: Calling this method with set to 1 () does not typically generate an event unless there are no other characters loaded or your application is already input-active.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.GenerateIcon(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates a notification icon from one frame of the character's animations.
member.param: An optional numeric value that specifies the left side of the clipping area. The default value is 0.
An optional numeric value that specifies the top of the clipping area. The default value is 0.
An optional numeric value that specifies the width of the clipping area. The default value is -1, meaning the full width of the animation frame.
An optional numeric value that specifies the height of the clipping area. The default value is -1, meaning the full width of the animation frame.

remarks.para: The icon is generated using the first frame of one of the character's animations as the source of the icon image. Which animation is used depends on which animations the character supports.
You can specify an optional clipping area to generate the icon from only a part of the animation frame.
If you don't specify a clipping area, the entire image is used (with any empty space around the edges removed).
remarks.note: You can only use this method once per character. Once a notification icon has been generated, it cannot be changed.
If you use this method for a character that has a notification icon in its definition, the defined icon is replaced by the generated icon for as long as the character is loaded.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.GestureAt(System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Plays a character's gesturing animation towards the specified location.
member.param: A numeric value that indicates the horizontal screen coordinate, in pixels, to which the character will gesture.
A numeric value that indicates the vertical screen coordinate, in pixels, to which the character will gesture.
An optional unique numeric value your application can use to track the method's status.

remarks.para: Double Agent automatically plays the appropriate animation to gesture toward the specified location. The coordinates are always relative to the upper left corner of the screen.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Hide(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Hides the character.
member.param: A boolean value that indicates whether to skip the character's Hiding state animation.
An optional unique numeric value your application can use to track the method's status.

remarks.para: Double Agent queues the actions of the Hide method in the character's queue, so you can use it to hide the character after a sequence of other animations. You can play the action immediately by using the or method before calling this method.
remarks.note: Hiding a character can trigger the event of another client.
Hidden characters cannot access the screen or the audio channel. Double Agent will pass a failure status in the event if you attempt to animate a hidden character.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Interrupt(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Interrupts an animation for another character.
member.param: The for the animation call you want to interrupt.
An optional unique numeric value your application can use to track the method's status.

remarks.para: You can use this to synchronize animation between characters. For example, if another character is in a looping animation, this method will stop the loop and move to the next animation in the character's queue.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Listen(System.Int32)
member.summary: Turns on Listening mode (speech recognition) for a timed period.
member.param: A boolean value that determines whether to turn Listening mode on or off.

remarks.para: Setting the parameter to True enables Listening mode (turns on speech recognition) for a fixed period of time (10 seconds). While you cannot set the value of the time-out, you can turn off Listening mode before the time-out expires.

If you (or another client) successfully set Listening mode on and you attempt to set this property to True before the time-out expires, the method succeeds and resets the time-out. However, if the Listening mode is on because the user is pressing the Listening key, the method succeeds, but the time-out is ignored and Listening mode ends based on the user's interaction with the Listening key.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.MoveTo(System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Moves the character to the specified location.
member.param: The horizontal location, in pixels, relative to the left side of the screen.
The vertical location, in pixels, relative to the top of the screen.
An optional numeric value specifying how quickly the character's image moves, in milliseconds. The default value is 1000. Specifying zero moves the image without playing an animation.
An optional unique numeric value your application can use to track the method's status.

remarks.para: The location of a character is based on the upper left corner of its image. Double Agent automatically plays the appropriate animation assigned to the Moving states.
remarks.note: The parameter's actual effect may vary based on the computer's processor speed and the priority of other tasks running on the system.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Play(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Plays the specified animation.
member.param: A string value that specifies the name of an animation sequence.
An optional unique numeric value your application can use to track the method's status.

remarks.para: An animation's name is defined when the character is authored. Before playing the specified animation, Double Agent attempts to play the Return animation for the previous animation, if one has been assigned.
The Play method does not make the character visible. If the character is not visible, Double Agent plays the animation invisibly, and sets the parameter of the Event.

When accessing a character's animations using a conventional file protocol, you can simply use thePlay method specifying the name of the animation. However, if you're using the HTTP protocol to access character animation data, use the method to load the animation before calling the Play method.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Prepare(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified animation data for the a remote character.
member.param:
One of the following members of the Enumeration:
0 = Animation … Download an animation.
1 = State … Download all animations for a state.
2 = Wave … Download a sound file.

A string that indicates the name of the animation resource.
For animations, the name is one of those defined for the character when it was authored.
For states, the name is one of those defined for the character when it was authored. See the property for details.
For audio files, specify the location of the .WAV file. If an incomplete path is specified, it's interpreted as being relative to the location used in the method.
You can specify multiple animations and states by separating them with commas. However, you cannot mix types in the same Prepare call.
A boolean value specifying whether the Double Agent queues the Prepare, or starts it immediately.
An optional unique numeric value your application can use to track the method's status.

remarks.para: If you load a character using the HTTP protocol (an .ACF file), you should use the Prepare method to retrieve animation data before you play the animation. You do not use this method if you loaded the character using the UNC protocol (an .ACS file).

Using the Prepare method is not mandatory. If Double Agent requires an animation from an .ACS file, it will load the file automatically (from the same location the .ACF file was loaded). However, this may cause unexpected delays when using the HTTP protocol.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.SetIconIdentity(System.Guid@)
member.summary: Sets the identity that Windows will use to remember the character's notification icon.
member.param: A GUID value that allows Windows to uniquely identify this character's notification icon. It must be either a value GUID or GUID_NULL.
member.remarks:
Every notification icon has an identity that allows Windows to remember it's state (shown, hidden, active, etc.). By default, Windows associates a notification icon with the application that creates it.
You can supply either a GUID identifier, or GUID_NULL to use the default identity.
A character's notification icon will be associated with the Double Agent server by default.
You can supply a single GUID for all characters you load. All of their notification icons will be associated with that single identity.
You can supply a unique GUID for each character you load. Windows will then identify each character's notification icon uniquely. This property applies only to your client application's use of the character; the setting does not affect other clients of the character or other characters of your client application.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Show(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Shows the character and optionally plays its associated Showing animation.
member.param: A boolean value specifying whether or not the Showing state animation is played.
An optional unique numeric value your application can use to track the method's status.

remarks.para: Avoid setting the parameter to True without first playing an animation; otherwise, the character may be shown with no image. In particular, note that if you call when the character is not visible, it does not play any animation. Therefore, if you call the Show method with set to True, no image will display. Similarly, if you call , then Show with set to True, there will be no visible image.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.ShowPopupMenu(System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary: Displays the character's pop-up menu at the specified location.
member.param: The horizontal screen coordinate to display the menu, in pixels.
The vertical screen coordinate to display the menu, in pixels.

remarks.para: If the character's property includes , Double Agent automatically displays the character's pop-up menu when the user right-clicks the character. If you set the property without , you can use ShowPopupMenu to display the menu.

The menu remains displayed until the user selects a command or displays another menu. Only one pop-up menu can be displayed at a time; therefore, calls to this method will cancel (remove) the former menu.
This method should be called only when your client application is the active client of the character; otherwise it fails.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Speak(System.String,System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Speaks the specified text or sound file.
member.param: A string value that specifies what the character says.

A string value specifying the location of an audio file (.WAV format). The location can be specified as a file (including a UNC path specification) or URL (when character animation data is also being retrieved via HTTP protocol).
An optional unique numeric value your application can use to track the method's status.

remarks.para: At least one of the and parameters must be supplied. To use this method with a character configured to speak only in its word balloon or using a text-to-speech (TTS) engine, simply provide the parameter. Include a space between words to define appropriate word breaks in the word balloon, even for languages that do not traditionally include spaces.
You can also include vertical bar '|' characters in the parameter to designate alternative strings, so that Double Agent randomly chooses a different string each time it processes the method.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Stop(System.Int32)
member.summary: Stops an animation.
member.param: A numeric value that identifies a particular animation call.

remarks.para: To specify the parameter, you must save the value returned by the animation call.
remarks.note: This method does not stop non-queued calls.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.StopAll(System.Int32)
member.summary: Stops all animation requests or specified types of requests.
member.param:
A numeric value specifying the types of actions to stop. You can use any combination of the following members of the Enumeration:
0x00000001 = Play … Stop any pending or running animations.
0x00000002 = Move … Stop any pending or running move requests.
0x00000004 = Speak … Stop any pending or running speech requests.
0x00000008 = QueuedPrepare … Stop any queued animation or file downloads (Prepare method with Queue parameter set to True).
0x00000010 = ImmediatePrepare … Stop any non-queued animation or file downloads (Prepare method with Queue parameter set to False)
0x00000020 = Visibility … Stop any pending show or hide requests.
0xFFFFFFFF = Everything … Stop all pending requests.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Think(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Displays the specified text in the character's thought word balloon.
member.param: A string value that specifies the character's thought output.
An optional unique numeric value your application can use to track the method's status.

remarks.para: Like the method, the Think method is a queued request that displays text in a word balloon, except that the Think word balloon differs visually. In addition, the word balloon supports only the bookmark speech control tag (Mrk) and ignores any other speech control tags. Unlike , the Think method does not change the character's animation state.
The Object's properties affect the output of both the and Think methods. For example, the Object's property must be True for text to display.

Agent's automatic word breaking in the word balloon breaks words using white-space characters (for example, SPACE or TAB). However, if it cannot, it may break a word to fit the word balloon. In languages like Japanese, Chinese, and Thai where spaces are not used to break words, insert a Unicode zero-width space character (0x200B) between characters to define logical word breaks.
remarks.note: Set the character's before using the Think method to ensure appropriate text display within the word balloon.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Wait(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Causes the character's animation queue to wait until the specified animation request completes.
member.param: A numeric value specifying the animation to wait for.
An optional unique numeric value your application can use to track the method's status.

remarks.para: Use this method only when you are using multiple (simultaneous) characters and are trying to sequence the interaction of characters. (For a single character, each animation request is played sequentially--after the previous request completes.)
If you have two characters and you want one character's animation request to wait until the other character's animation completes, use the Wait method with the other character's animation value.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.ActiveState
member.summary: Indicates if your application is the character's active client and if the character is input-active.
member.returns:
A member of the Enumeration indicating the state of the character and your client application:
0 = Inactive … Your client application is not the character's active client.
1 = Active … Your client application is the character's active client.
2 = InputActive … The character is the input-active character and will receive user input.

remarks.para: When multiple client applications share the same character, the character's active client receives mouse input (for example, Double Agent control Click or Drag events). Similarly, when multiple characters are displayed, the active client of the topmost character (also known as the input-active client) receives Command events.
You can use the method to set whether your application is the character's active client or to make your application the input-active client (which also makes the character topmost).

member.returns: An array of string values that name all of the animations the character can play.

remarks.para: For .ACF characters, the array contains all the animations defined for the character, not just the ones that have been retrieved with the method.

The character's default Description for a specific language is defined when the character is compiled with the Microsoft® Agent Character Editor.
remarks.note: The Description property is optional and may not be supplied for all characters.
This property applies to all clients of the character.

member.returns: A string that contains any additional data stored as part of the character.

remarks.note: The ExtraData property setting is optional and may not be supplied for all characters.

member.returns: A string value that contains the character's definition file path.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.HasIcon
member.summary: Indicates if the character has a notification icon in its definition.
member.returns: A boolean value that indicates if the character definition includes a notification icon.

remarks.para: If the character definition does not include an icon (or even if it does) you can use the method to create an icon from the character's animations.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the character's image.
member.returns: A numeric value that specifies the height of the character's image.

remarks.para: The Height property is always expressed in pixels.

Even though the character appears in an irregularly shaped region window, the dimensions of the character are based on the external dimensions of the rectangular animation frame used when the character was compiled with the Microsoft® Agent Character Editor.
remarks.note: This property applies to all clients of the character.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.IconIdentity
member.summary: Specifies the identity that Windows will use to remember the character's notification icon.
member.returns: A string value that allows Windows to uniquely identify this character's notification icon. It must be either a valid GUID string or an empty string.
member.remarks:
Every notification icon has an identity that allows Windows to remember it's state (shown, hidden, active, etc.). By default, Windows associates a notification icon with the application that creates it.
You can supply either a GUID identifier, or an empty string to use the default identity.
A character's notification icon will be associated with the Double Agent server by default.
You can supply a single GUID for all characters you load. All of their notification icons will be associated with that single identity.
You can supply a unique GUID for each character you load. Windows will then identify each character's notification icon uniquely. This property applies only to your client application's use of the character; the setting does not affect other clients of the character or other characters of your client application.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.IconTip
member.summary: Specifies the tip text associated with the character's notification icon.
member.returns: A string value that specifies the notification icon's tip text. An empty string means that the default tip (the character's name) is used.

remarks.para: By default, the character's is shown in the notification icon tip. You can use this property to show your own tip.
remarks.note: This property applies only to your client application's use of the character; the setting does not affect other clients of the character or other characters of your client application.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.IconVisible
member.summary: Indicates if the character has a notification icon in the Windows notification area.
member.returns: A boolean value that indicates if the character is showing a notification icon.

remarks.para: This property only indicates if the notification icon has been created. The user decides if the icon is actually visible or hidden.

The style only applies to your client application, so it is only in effect when you application is the character's active client. When your application is not the character's active client, you can use this property to determine if another client has shown or hidden the notification icon.
remarks.note: This property applies to all clients of the character.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.IdleState
member.summary: Indicates if the character is currently playing its Idling animations.
member.returns: A boolean value that indicates if the character is idling.

remarks.note: This property applies to all clients of the character.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.LanguageID
member.summary: Specifies the character's language identifier.
member.returns: A numeric value specifying the character's language ID. A character's language ID (LANGID) is a 16-bit value defined by Windows, consisting of a primary language ID and a secondary language ID.

remarks.para: If you do not set the character's LanguageID, it defaults to the current system language.

This property also determines the language for word balloon text, the commands in the character's pop-up menu, the default language for text-to-speech output, and the default speech recognition language.
If an appropriate Agent language DLL for the specified LanguageID is not installed, the commands in the character's pop-up menu and Voice Commands window will be in English.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Left
member.summary: Specifies the left edge of the character's image.
member.returns: A numeric value that specifies the left edge of the character's image.

remarks.para: The Left property is always expressed in pixels, relative to screen origin (upper left).

Even though the character appears in an irregularly shaped region window, the location of the character is based on the external dimensions of the rectangular animation frame used when the character was compiled with the Microsoft® Agent Character Editor.
remarks.note: This property applies to all clients of the character.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.ListeningStatus
member.summary: Indicates if speech input can be started for the character.
member.returns:
One of the following members of the Enumeration:
0 = Available … Conditions support speech input.
2 = CharacterInactive … Speech recognition is unavailable because another client is the active client of this character, or the current character is not input-active.
4 = InitializeFailed … Speech recognition is unavailable because it could not be initialized. This includes the possibility that there is no speech engine available matching the character's language setting.
5 = InputDisabled … The user has disabled speech input in the Advanced Character Options window.
6 = Error … The speech recognition status could not be determined.

remarks.para: This property checks for the conditions necessary to support speech input. You can check this property before you call the method to better ensure its success.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.MoveCause
member.summary: Returns the cause of the character's last move.
member.returns:
One of the following members of the Enumeration:
0 = NeverMoved … The character hasn't moved.
1 = UserMoved … The user dragged the character.
2 = ProgramMoved … Your client application moved the character.
3 = OtherProgramMoved … Another client application moved the character.

remarks.para: You can use this property to determine what caused the character to move, when more than one application is sharing (has loaded) the same character. These values are the same as those returned by the event.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Name
member.summary: Specifies the specified character's displayed name.
member.returns: A string value corresponding to the character's name (in the current language setting).

remarks.para: A character's Name may depend on the character's setting. A character's name in one language may be different or use different characters than in another. The character's default Name for a specific language is defined when the character is compiled with the Microsoft® Agent Character Editor.

Avoid renaming a character, especially when using it in a scenario where other client applications may use the same character. Also, Double Agent uses the character's Name to automatically create commands for hiding and showing the character.
remarks.note: This property applies to all clients of the character.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.OriginalHeight

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.OriginalWidth

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.OtherClientCount
member.summary: Returns the number of other client applications that are using this character.
member.returns: A numeric value that indicates the number of other client applications that have loaded this character.

remarks.para: You can use this property to determine if your application is the character's only client, or if another application is sharing (has loaded) the same character.
remarks.note: Double Agent uses the property, not the property, to determine if the same character is being used by more than one client application.
If your application uses multiple instances of the Object, each instance is a treated as a different client and this property will return a non-zero value.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.SREngine(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the character's current or default "Speech Recognition Engine" Object.
member.param: An optional boolean value that indicates if you want the character's current or default speech recognition engine. The default value is False.
member.returns: A Object that corresponds to the character's current or default .

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.SRModeID
member.summary: Specifies the speech recognition engine the character uses.
member.returns: A string value that identifies a speech recognition engine.

remarks.para: This property determines the speech recognition engine used by the character for speech input. The SRModeID for a speech recognition engine is a formatted string defined by the vendor that uniquely identifies the engine.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.States
member.summary: Returns the names of the character's state animations.
member.returns: An array of string values that name all of the state animations the character can play.
member.remarks:
For .ACF characters, the array contains all the states defined for the character, not just the ones that have been retrieved with the method.
Most characters include the following states:
"Gesturing" or "GesturingDown", "GesturingLeft", "GesturingRight" and "GesturingUp"
"Hiding"
"Hearing"
"Idling" or "IdlingLevel1", "IdlingLevel2" and "IdlingLevel3"
"Listening"
"Moving" or "MovingDown", "MovingLeft", "MovingRight" and "MovingUp"
"Showing"
"Speaking"

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Style
member.summary: Specifies a group of settings that affect the character's appearance.
member.returns:
A numeric bit-field value that has one or more of the following:
0x00000001 = SoundEffects … The animation sound effects are played.
0x00000002 = IdleEnabled … The character enters idle mode and shows it's idling animations when it's not doing anything else.
0x00000004 = AutoPopupMenu … A right-click on the character or it's notification icon automatically shows a pop-up menu.
0x00000008 = IconShown … The character has a notification icon in the taskbar notification area.
0x00000020 = SmoothEdges … Image smoothing (antialiasing) is applied to the edges of the character's animations.
0x00000030 = Smoothed … Image smoothing (antialiasing) is applied to the character's animations.
0x00000100 = SuspendPause … All requests are paused when the client is not in the foreground.
0x00000200 = SuspendStop … All requests are stopped when the client is not in the foreground.
0x00000400 = SuspendHide … All floating windows are hidden when the client is not in the foreground.

remarks.para: The and bits are read-only. They can only be set in the . property before the is loaded.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Top
member.summary: Specifies the top edge of the character's image.
member.returns: A numeric value that specifies the top left edge of the character's image.

remarks.para: The Top property is always expressed in pixels, relative to screen origin (upper left).

Even though the character appears in an irregularly shaped region window, the location of the character is based on the external dimensions of the rectangular animation frame used when the character was compiled with the Microsoft® Agent Character Editor.
remarks.note: This property applies to all clients of the character.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.TTSEngine(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the character's current or default "Text-To-Speech Engine" Object.
member.param: An optional boolean value that indicates if you want the character's current or default text-to-speech engine. The default value is False.
member.returns: A Object that corresponds to the character's current or default .

remarks.para: If you change the character's you must re-access this property to get the correct current Object.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.TTSModeID
member.summary: Specifies the text-to-speech engine used for the character.
member.returns: A string value that uniquely identifies a text-to-speech engine and synthesis mode.

remarks.para: This property determines the TTS (text-to-speech) engine for a character's spoken output. The TTSModeID for a TTS engine is a formatted string defined by the vendor that uniquely identifies the engine and it's synthesis mode.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.UniqueID
member.summary: Returns the unique identifier given to the character when it was defined.
member.returns: A string value containing the the character's unique (GUID) identifier.

remarks.para: This property returns a string representing the internal identifier that Double Agent uses to uniquely identify the character. A character identifier is set when it is compiled with the Microsoft® Agent Character Editor.
remarks.note: This is the value that Double Agent uses to determine if a character has already been loaded. The character's file name or location does not uniquely identify the character.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.VisibilityCause
member.summary: Returns a Enumeration value that specifies what caused the character's visible state to change.
member.returns:
A Enumeration value:
0 = NeverShown … The character has not been shown.
1 = UserHid … The user hid the character using the command on the character's notification icon or using speech input.
2 = UserShowed … The user showed the character using the command on the character's notification icon or using speech input.
3 = ProgramHid … Your application hid the character.
4 = ProgramShowed … Your application showed the character.
5 = OtherProgramHid … Another client application hid the character.
6 = OtherProgramShowed … Another client application showed the character.

remarks.para: You can use this property to determine what caused the character to change visibility when more than one application is sharing (has loaded) the same character. These values are the same as those received by the event.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Visible
member.summary: Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the character is visible.
member.returns: True if the character is displayed, False if it's hidden

remarks.para: This property indicates whether the character's animations are being displayed. It does not necessarily mean that there is an image on the screen. For example, this property returns True even when the character is positioned off the visible display area or when the current character animation contains no images.
This property is read-only. To change a character's visibility, use the or method.
remarks.note: This property applies to all clients of the character.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the character's image.
member.returns: A numeric value that specifies the width of the character's image.

remarks.para: The Width property is always expressed in pixels.

Even though the character appears in an irregularly shaped region window, the dimensions of the character are based on the external dimensions of the rectangular animation frame used when the character was compiled with the Microsoft® Agent Character Editor.
remarks.note: This property applies to all clients of the character.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.NewFormattedText
member.summary: Returns an initialized, empty Object.
member.returns: A Object.

remarks.para: The returned Object is initialized to handle speech tags consistent with the "Character's" current Text-to-Speech engine.

Once you have completed the Object, you can pass it to either the or method. If you plan to use the same text more than once, keep a reference to the Object and reuse it. This can improve the performance of your application.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.SpeakFormatted(DoubleAgent.Server.FormattedText,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Speaks the specified text.
member.param: A Object object containing the text to be spoken.
An optional unique numeric value your application can use to track the method's status.

remarks.para: This method is the same as the method, except that the input text is already parsed and formatted, and using this method triggers the , , and events.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.Character.ThinkFormatted(DoubleAgent.Server.FormattedText,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Displays the specified text in the character's thought word balloon.
member.param: A Object object containing the text to be displayed.
An optional unique numeric value your application can use to track the method's status.

remarks.note: This methods does not trigger the SpeechStart, SpeechEnd, and SpeechWord events.

summary.para: The Character Object provides the methods and properties your application will use to access the bulk of Double Agent's features.

remarks.para: Because the server loads an HTTP character asynchronously, ensure that the character has been loaded before querying its properties, for example, using the event. Otherwise, the properties may return incorrect values.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.FormattedText.Append(DoubleAgent.Server.FormattedText)
member.summary: Appends one Object to another Object.
member.param: The Object to append.

remarks.para: The appended text starts a new paragraph; a new-line character separates the existing and appended text.
remarks.note: This method will fail if the Object is currently being used by a queued speech or thought action.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.Server.FormattedText.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses text containing speech tags.
member.param: A string value containing text with optional speech output tags.

remarks.para: The kind of speech tags accepted depends on the Text-to-Speech engine selected for the when the Object was created. If the is using a SAPI4 speech engine, then SAPI4 speech tags are accepted. If the is using a SAPI5 speech engine, then SAPI5 speech tags and supported SAPI4 speech tags are accepted. Any supported SAPI4 tags are converted to SAPI5 tags.
For more information about speech tags, see Speech Output Tags.
remarks.note: This method will fail if the Object is currently being used by a queued speech or thought action.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.FormattedText.DisplayText
member.summary: Returns the text displayed in the word balloon.
member.returns: A string value that contains the up to and including the current .

remarks.para: The value of this property does not depend on the "Balloon's" , or even if a word balloon is shown. It reflects what would be displayed in a word balloon with the and styles.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.FormattedText.DisplayWord(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the for a specific .
member.param: A numeric value specifying the zero-based index of the word to return. Must be less than .
member.returns: A string value that contains the at the specified .

remarks.para: The returned string includes trailing white-space, but not leading white-space.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.FormattedText.ParsedText
member.summary: Returns the text formatted for display.
member.returns: A string value containing the text formatted for displaying in a word balloon.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.FormattedText.RawText
member.summary: Returns the unformatted text.
member.returns: A string value containing the unformatted text.

remarks.para: After you use the Method, this property will return the text passed in the RawText parameter.
If you use this property to set the RawText value, it does not get parsed. The RawText value will be used for both the and the .

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.FormattedText.SpeechText
member.summary: Returns the text formatted for the Text-to-Speech engine.
member.returns: A string value containing the text formatted for sending to the Text-to-Speech engine.

remarks.para: This property contains speech tags formatted for the Text-to-Speech engine selected for the when the Object was created.
For more information about speech tags, see Speech Output Tags.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.FormattedText.WordCount
member.summary: Returns the number of words in the and properties.
member.returns: A numeric value that indicates how many words are in the parsed text.

remarks.para: The WordCount reflects how text is displayed in the word balloon and how the is synchronized with the speech output.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.FormattedText.WordIndex
member.summary: Returns the index of the word currently being spoken and/or displayed.
member.returns: A numeric value that indicates the zero-based index of the current word.

remarks.note: If speech or thought output has not yet begun, this property's value will be -1.

summary.para: The FormattedText object is used to pre-format text that is to be spoken, or shown in a thought word balloon.

remarks.para: If your application uses the same text for multiple calls to the or method, it can be more efficient to pre-format the text in a FormattedText object and use the or method instead.
Also, if you want to receive the , , and events, you must use the method.

member.returns: A string value that contains the name of the default character's definition file.

member.summary: Returns the full path of the default character's definition file.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.CharacterFiles.DefaultSearchPath
member.summary: Identifies the default search path used to fill the property.
member.returns: A string value that identifies one or more UNC paths, separated by semicolons.

remarks.para: This property returns the default search path, based on the selection criteria specified by the property. The actual search path can be set with the property.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.CharacterFiles.FilePaths
member.summary: Returns a list of character file paths that satisfy the filtering criteria defined by other properties in the Object.
member.returns: An array of string values that identify locally available character definition files.

remarks.para: This property is the raison d'être of the Object. As you change the other properties in this object, the contents of this array will change accordingly.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.CharacterFiles.Filter
member.summary: Specifies the filtering criteria applied to the and properties.
member.returns:
A numeric bit-field that contains any of the following values:
0x00000001 = PathDoubleAgent … Indicates if the Double Agent install location should be included in the .
0x00000002 = PathMsAgent … Indicates if the Microsoft® Agent install location should be included in the .
0x00000004 = PathMsOffice … Indicates if the Microsoft® Office install location should be included in the .
0x00000010 = ExcludeNonCompliant … Indicates if the property should exclude characters that do not conform to Microsoft® Agent design guidelines.
0x00000020 = ExcludeCompliant … Indicates if the property should exclude characters that conform to Microsoft® Agent design guidelines.
0x00000040 = ExcludeNonSpeaking … Indicates if the property should exclude characters that are not designed to speak.
0x00000080 = ExcludeSpeaking … Indicates if the property should exclude characters that are designed to speak.
0x00010000 = NoValidateVersion … Indicates if the the property should include all character files, regardless of version.

remarks.para: The path for Double Agent characters is the Chars subdirectory of the Double Agent install location. Typically, this would be C:\Program Files\Double Agent\Chars.
The path for Microsoft® Agent characters is the Chars subdirectory of the Microsoft® Agent install location. Typically, this would be C:\Windows\MsAgent\Chars.
Typically, Microsoft® Office characters would be in C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Office10.
remarks.note: Only older versions of Microsoft Office include Agent character files.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.CharacterFiles.SearchPath
member.summary: Identifies the actual search path used to fill the property. Unless you have special requirements, this is usually the same as the property.
member.returns: A string value that identifies one or more UNC paths, separated by semicolons.

remarks.para: When this property is set to an empty string, it returns the .
Normally, you would leave this property alone and allow the to be used. You would only set this property if you wanted to search for character files in non-default locations.

summary.para: The CharacterFiles Object provides information that allows you to locate locally installed character definition files. It includes a that specifies where to look for character files, and what kind of files to find. The results are returned in its property.

member.returns: A string value that specifies the text displayed in the menu.

remarks.para: To specify an access key (underlined mnemonic) for your Caption, include an ampersand (&) before the mnemonic character.
If you don't define a for your command, the Caption property will be used.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Command.CommandID
member.summary: Returns the Object's unique identifier.
member.returns: A numeric value that uniquely identifies the Object in the Collection.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Command.ConfidenceText
member.summary: Specifies the text that appears in the Listening tip.
member.returns: A string value that specifies the text displayed in the Listening tip.

remarks.para: When the value of the best match does not exceed the command's property, Double Agent displays the text specified in ConfidenceText in the Listening tip.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Command.ConfidenceThreshold
member.summary: Specifies if the command's appears in the Listening tip.
member.returns: A numeric value that specifies the confidence threshold for the command.

remarks.para: If the value of the best match does not exceed the value you set for the ConfidenceThreshold property, the text supplied in is displayed in the Listening tip.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Command.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies if the is enabled in the character's pop-up menu.
member.returns: A boolean value that indicates if the command is enabled.

remarks.para: If the Enabled property is set to True, the Object's appears as normal text in the character's pop-up menu when the client application is input-active. If the Enabled property is False, the appears as unavailable (disabled) text. A disabled is also not accessible for voice input.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Command.Visible
member.summary: Specifies if the is visible in the character's pop-up menu.
member.returns: A boolean value that indicates if the command is visible.

remarks.para: Set this property to False when you want to include voice input for your command without having it appear in the pop-up menu for the character. If you set a Object's property to the empty string (""), the caption text will not appear in the pop-up menu (for example, as a blank line), regardless of its Visible property setting.
The Visible property of a Object's parent Collection does not affect the Visible property of the .

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Command.VoiceCaption
member.summary: Specifies the text displayed for the Object in the Voice Commands window.
member.returns: A string value that specifies the Voice Commands window text.

remarks.para: This text will appear in the Voice Commands window when your client application is input-active and the character is visible. If this property is not set, the property is used instead. When neither the VoiceCaption nor property is set, the command does not appear in the Voice Commands window.
If you define a Object in a Collection with a non-blank property, you will typically also set the Object's VoiceCaption property.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Command.VoiceGrammar
member.summary: Specifies the grammar text that is passed to the speech recognition engine for matching this .
member.returns: A string value that specifies the recognition text.

remarks.para: If you do not supply this parameter, the for your Object will not appear in the Voice Commands window. If you specify a VoiceGrammar parameter but not a (or ), the command will not appear in the Voice Commands window, but it will be voice-accessible when the client application becomes input-active.

summary.para: A Command Object is an item in a Collection. Double Agent provides the user access to your Command Objects when your client application becomes input-active.

remarks.para: A command may appear in either the character's pop-up menu and the Voice Commands window, or in both. To appear in the pop-up menu it must have a and have the property set to True. In addition, its Collection's property must also be set to True. To appear in the Voice Commands window, a Command must have its and properties set.

When Double Agent receives input for one of your commands, it sends a event, and passes back the name of the Command as an attribute of the Object. You can then use conditional statements to match and process the Command.

Note that a character's pop-up menu entries do not change while the menu is displayed. If you add or remove commands or change their properties while the character's pop-up menu is displayed, the menu reflects those changes whenever the user next shows it. However, the Voice Commands window dynamically reflects any changes you make.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Commands.Caption
member.summary: Specifies the text displayed for the Collection in the character's pop-up menu.
member.returns: A string value that specifies the text displayed in the menu.

remarks.para: Setting the Caption property for your Collection defines how it will appear on the character's pop-up menu when its property is set to True and your application is not the input-active client. To specify an access key (underlined mnemonic) for your Caption, include an ampersand (&) before the mnemonic character.
If you define Objects for a Collection, you typically also define a Caption for the Collection.
