remarks.para: Count includes only the number of Objects you define in your Collection. Pre-defined entries or entries defined by other clients are not included.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Commands.DefaultCommand
member.summary: Specifies the default command of the Collection.
member.returns: The of the that's shown bold in the pop-up menu (or zero if none).

remarks.para: This property allows you to set a in your Collection as the default command, rendering it bold. This does not actually change command handling or double-click events.
remarks.note: This property applies only to your client application's use of the character; the setting does not affect other clients of the character or other characters of your client application.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Commands.FontName
member.summary: Specifies the font used in the Voice Commands window.
member.returns: A string value specifying the font name.

remarks.para: The FontName property defines the font used to display text in the Voice Commands window. The default value for the font setting is based on the menu font for the character's or, if that's not set, the user default language.
remarks.note: This property applies only to your client application's use of the character; the setting does not affect other clients of the character or other characters of your client application.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Commands.FontSize
member.summary: Specifies the font size used in the Voice Commands window.
member.returns: A numeric value specifying the font size (in points).

remarks.para: The FontSize property defines the point size of the font used to display text in the Voice Commands window. The default value for the font setting is based on the menu font for the character's or, if that's not set, the user default language.
remarks.note: This property applies only to your client application's use of the character; the setting does not affect other clients of the character or other characters of your client application.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Commands.GlobalVoiceCommandsEnabled
member.summary: Specifies if pre-defined commands appear in the Voice Commands window.
member.returns: A boolean value that indicates if global voice commands are enabled.

remarks.para: Double Agent automatically adds voice commands (grammar) for opening and closing the Voice Commands window and for showing and hiding the character. If you set GlobalVoiceCommandsEnabled to False, Agent disables any voice parameters for these voice commands as well as the voice commands for the of other clients' Collection. This allows you to eliminate these from your client's current active grammar. However, because this potentially blocks voice access to other clients, reset this property to True after processing the user's voice input.
Disabling the property does not affect the character's pop-up menu. The global commands added by Double Agent will still appear; you cannot remove them from the pop-up menu.

member.param: A numeric value that specifies the zero-based index of the item to retrieve.
member.returns: The Object at the specified .

remarks.para: When you want to use the Collection as an ordered collection, you can use the Item property instead of the property.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Commands.Visible
member.summary: Specifies if the Collection appears in the character's pop-up menu.
member.returns: A boolean value that indiciates if the is visible.

remarks.para: For the caption to appear in the character's pop-up menu when your application is not the input-active client, this property must be set to True and the property set for your Collection. In addition, this property must be set to True for commands in your collection to appear in the pop-up menu when your application is input-active.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Commands.VoiceCaption
member.summary: Specifies the text displayed for the Collection in the Voice Commands window.
member.returns: A string value that specifies the caption text.

remarks.para: The VoiceCaption text appears in the Voice Commands window when your client application is input-active and the character is visible. If this property is not set, the property is used instead. When neither the VoiceCaption nor property is set, then commands in the collection appear in the Voice Commands window under an (undefined command) title when your client application becomes input-active.
The VoiceCaption setting also determines the text displayed in the Listening tip to indicate the commands for which the character listens.
If you set the property of your Collection, you will typically also set its VoiceCaption property.

member.summary: Specifies the page displayed in the Advanced Character Options window.

A string value indicating the visible page.
"Output" … Selects the Output page.
"Speech" … Selects the Speech Input page.
"Character" … Selects the Gallery (default character selection) page.
"Copyright" … Selects the Copyright page.

remarks.para: If no speech engine is installed, setting Page to "Speech" has no effect. Also, the window's property must be set to True for the user to see the page.

summary.para: The PropertySheet Object provides access to the Advanced Character Options window. It allows you to show and hide the window, and retrieve and update the window's location and current page.

remarks.para: The Advanced Character Options window is shared among all Double Agent clients. Changes to the window's location and visibility should be made with this in mind.
This object can be accessed using the Object's property.
remarks.note: The Advanced Character Options window combines the Microsoft® Agent Advanced Character Options and Default Character Properties windows.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.Settings.AudioStatus
member.summary: Returns the status of the audio output channel.
member.returns:
A member of the Enumeration that indicates the current audio output status:
0 = Available … Text-to-speech is available.
1 = Disabled … Text-to-speech is disabled in the Advanced Character Options window.
3 = UserSpeaking … Listening mode is active and the user is currently speaking.
4 = CharacterSpeaking … A character is currently speaking.
5 = CharacterListening … Listening mode is active.
6 = Error … The audio status could not be determined.

remarks.para: Your client application can use this property to determine whether it is appropriate to have your character speak or whether it is appropriate to try to turn on Listening mode (using the method).

summary.para: The Settings Object provides access to various settings maintained by Double Agent. The properties are read-only for client applications, but the user can change them in the Advanced Character Options window.

remarks.para: The Settings Object replaces and extends the and Objects.

remarks.note: For some properties, Double Agent returns a relevant value only if a compatible speech engine has been installed and is enabled.

member.param: A value that specifies the zero-based index of the item to retrieve. Must be less than .
member.returns:
If the property is zero: … The of the chosen , or zero if the chosen command was pre-defined (for example, the Hide command).
If the property is non-zero: … The of the Nth best matching (where N is +1).

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Server.UserInput.ItemText(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the voice text that the speech recognition engine matched for a .
member.param: A value that specifies the zero-based index of the item to retrieve. Must be less than .
member.returns: The Nth best matching voice text (where N is +1).

remarks.para: Even if no command was matched, the text that the speech engine heard is returned at zero.

summary.para: Double Agent sends the event when your application is input-active and the user chooses a command from the character's pop-up menu or by spoken input. The event passes a UserInput Object that identifies the number of possible matching commands as well as the name, confidence scoring, and voice text for those matches.

remarks.para: Not all speech recognition engines may return all the values for all the properties of this object. Check with your engine vendor to determine whether the engine supports the Microsoft® Speech API interface for returning alternatives and confidence scores.
